Detailed Description

The service list module. Everything starts by getting the currently available service list. The service list can then be manipulated before being saved in the DB and automatically advertised in the SSID.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct service_impl service

A service to be included in a service list.

typedef struct service_list_impl service_list

A list of services advertised in the SSID.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum err

The possible errors.

Enumerator:
SUCCESS  There is no error.
SERVICE_SET_FULL  The service set ads will not fit in the SSID.

Function Documentation

int add_service_first ( service_list *  sl,
const service *  s 
)

Adds a new service as the first member of the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that will contain the new service.
[in] s the service to be added.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

const service *  s 
)

Adds a new service as the last member of the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that will contain the new service.
[in] s the service to be added.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

size_t count_service ( const service_list *  sl  ) 

Count the number of elements in a service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list whose elements are to be counted.
Returns:
the number of services contained in the service list.

int create_service ( service *  s,
unsigned long  cat_id,
const char *  desc,
const char *  long_desc,
const char *  uri 
)

Creates a service having the specified attributes. The created service should be freed later with destroy_service().

Parameters:
[out] s the resulting service object.
[in] cat_id the mandatory category ID of the service.
[in] desc the optional description of the service for the SSID ads.
[in] long_desc the optional long description of the service.
[in] uri the mandatory URI to obtain the service.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int del_service_all ( service_list *  sl  ) 

Deletes all services.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that to be emptied.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int del_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Deletes a service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that contains the service.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

void destroy_service ( service **  s  ) 

Frees the memory allocated through create_service() or get_service_at() and sets the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is okay but not a NULL pointer.

Parameters:
[in] s the service to be freed.

void destroy_service_list ( service_list **  sl  ) 

Frees the memory allocated through load_service_list() and sets the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is okay but not a NULL pointer.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list to be freed.

int disable_service_all ( service_list *  sl  ) 

Disables all services.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that to be disabled.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int disable_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Disables a service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that contains the service.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

const char* errtostr ( int  err  ) 

Translates an error code to a human-readable string.

Parameters:
[in] err the error code to be translated.
Returns:
a read-only string explaining the error code.

int get_service_at ( const service_list *  sl,
service *  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Gets a copy of the service at the specified index in the service list. The copy should later be freed with destroy_service().

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that has the service.
[out] s a pointer to the dynamically allocated copy of the service.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int insert_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
const service *  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Inserts a new service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that will contain the new service.
[in] s the service to be added.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int load_service_list ( service_list **  sl  ) 

Loads the currently published service list.

Parameters:
[out] sl the pointer pointing to dynamically allocated memory that should be freed with destroy_service_list().
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int replace_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
const service *  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Replaces a service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that contains the service.
[in] s the new service that will replace the old one.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int save_service_list ( const service_list *  sl  ) 

Saves the service list in the published service database and advertises the service list in the SSID accordingly.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list to be saved.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.
